title: 5 Easy Ways to Select Pixels in Adobe Photoshop

steps.title: Open Photoshop on your Mac or PC.
steps.content: Open Photoshop on your Mac or PC. It’s in the All Apps area of the Start menu (Windows) or in the Applications folder (macOS).

steps.title: Open the file you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the file you want to edit.

steps.title: Right-click the Selection tool.
steps.content: Right-click the Selection tool. It’s the second icon from the top of the toolbar that runs along the left side of the screen. A list of selection tools will appear.

steps.title: Select Rectangular Marquee Tool.
steps.content: Select Rectangular Marquee Tool .

steps.title: Select an area.
steps.content: Select an area. Click the mouse at the location where you want to start selecting, then drag it until the desired area is selected. To include or remove pixels from the selection, click the Select menu, select Refine Edge , then choose an option. To deselect an area, press Ctrl + D .

steps.title: Right-click the Lasso tool.
steps.content: Right-click the Lasso tool. It’s the third icon from the top of the icon bar that runs along the left side of the screen.

steps.title: Select the desired area.
steps.content: Select the desired area. Click the mouse where you want to start making your selection, then drag the line over the shape of the pixels. Keep clicking points on the edge of the desired selection until you’ve made it back to the first pixel. To include or remove pixels from the selection, click the Select menu, select Refine Edge , then choose an option. To deselect an area, press Ctrl + D .
